intro: Relbunium atherodes, commonly known as the pale sandwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Montiaceae family. It is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming habit and features small, clustered flowers that are typically pale green or white. The plant has narrow, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water, adapting it to arid or rocky environments. It is native to regions of southern Europe and parts of North Africa. Relbunium atherodes is often found in dry, sandy soils and is considered a rare and specialized species.
